47108.section: Thaw frozen cell from liquid nitrogen tank
47108.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"ds22g","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3qreq","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"cfa0t","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"safety","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"19vjt","text":"IMPORTANT, ALWAYS WEAR SAFETY GOGGLES WHEN THAWING","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"35prn","text":"CELLS!!","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

47108.section: Thaw frozen cell from liquid nitrogen tank
47108.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"2j2sk","text":"Take a vial of frozen cells from liquid nitrogen tank. If you have many vials you need to take out of the tank and thaw at a time, you can put them on dry ice while you are looking for other vials.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

47108.section: Thaw frozen cell from liquid nitrogen tank
47108.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"9qa9c","text":"Put the vials in   water bath with gentle shaking. Do not at any point let water get above 2/3 the height of the vial to prevent water from getting into the vial. Check the vial periodically. Take vial out when there is only a small chunk of ice left. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":163,"length":28}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":17,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"622k0","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"6ldli","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"BC2E87306B0011EBA98D07E9020DF081","id":0,"label":"","temperature":"37","unit":10}},"1":{"type":"safety","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"abkle","text":"This is the step a defective cryovial might explode! So be extra careful and always wear eye protection!","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

47108.section: Thaw frozen cell from liquid nitrogen tank
47108.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"cmt68","text":"Spray the vial with  . Wipe dry. In the hood, open the vial and take the cells out of the vial with a P1000 into a 15 ml conical tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":20,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"","data":{"concentration":"70","guid":"EF8B7C006B0011EBA98D07E9020DF081","id":0,"label":"EtOH","unit":124}}}}

47108.section: Thaw frozen cell from liquid nitrogen tank
47108.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"4c6m2","text":"Slowly add   to   to the conical tube with gentle agitation.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":11,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":16,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"2nvjh","text":"Add the first ml drop wise. This is to reduce the osmotic pressure the cells will experience. Do not add thawed cells directly to fresh media!","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"5","guid":"107256006B0111EBA98D07E9020DF081","id":0,"label":"","unit":2}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"10","guid":"0E0BDD506B0111EBA98D07E9020DF081","id":0,"label":"fresh E8","unit":2}}}}

47108.section: Thaw frozen cell from liquid nitrogen tank
47108.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"d2io5","text":"Pellet cells in the conical tube at  . Take off supernatant.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":36,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"257t1","text":"Resuspend the cell pellet in appropriate amount of media.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"centrifuge","mutability":"","data":{"centrifuge":"150","duration":180,"guid":"2FF0C6606B0111EBA98D07E9020DF081","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null,"temperature":"","temperatureUnit":10,"unit":34}}}}

47108.section: Thaw frozen cell from liquid nitrogen tank
47108.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"aimdp","text":"Plate the cells onto a matrigel coated plate and put the plate back into the incubator.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

47108.section: Thaw frozen cell from liquid nitrogen tank
47108.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"fq949","text":"Cells should attach within an hour of plating.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

47108.section: Thaw frozen cell from liquid nitrogen tank
47108.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"88cn3","text":"Check cells the next day. Some floating dead cells are OK. The survival is normally 40-70% depending on the freeze.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

47108.section: Regular maintenance of human pluripotent stem cells
47108.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"8h167","text":"Feed cells with E8 medium everyday. It is OK to double feed (feed twice the amount of media) and let the cells go without feeding for a couple days only when the cells are not too dense (eg. Right after a split).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

47108.section: Regular maintenance of human pluripotent stem cells
47108.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"bqupv","text":"When cells are 70-90% confluent, they need to be split.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

47108.section: Regular maintenance of human pluripotent stem cells
47108.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"6g9ce","text":"To split cells, follow the steps below. The volume is for one well of a 6-well plate. Change the volume of solution according to your culture vessel.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

47108.section: Regular maintenance of human pluripotent stem cells
47108.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"daqe1","text":"Take off media and rinse with  . Take off the PBS+EDTA and add another  . Let the plate sit in the hood for  - .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":30,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":71,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":108,"length":1},{"key":3,"offset":110,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"5suvd","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"1","guid":"E53E80706B0111EBA98D07E9020DF081","id":0,"label":"PBS+EDTA (0.5 mM EDTA final concentration)","unit":2}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"1","guid":"D2A21AA06C4E11EBA796A714FA997B99","id":0,"label":" PBS+EDTA","unit":2}},"2":{"type":"duration","mutability":"","data":{"duration":180,"guid":"F0A9A0C06B0111EBA98D07E9020DF081","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"3":{"type":"duration","mutability":"","data":{"duration":300,"guid":"F4299FC06B0111EBA98D07E9020DF081","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

47108.section: Regular maintenance of human pluripotent stem cells
47108.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"7rrm9","text":"Look under the microscope. The cells within a colony should start to separate from each other. If they are still attached to each other, wait for another   -   and check again.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":154,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":157,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"fcje0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"","data":{"duration":120,"guid":"755B35606C4F11EBA796A714FA997B99","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"","data":{"duration":180,"guid":"7A8EB0C06C4F11EBA796A714FA997B99","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

47108.section: Regular maintenance of human pluripotent stem cells
47108.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"63quk","text":"Carefully take the PBS+EDTA off the plate. If the cells are incubated too long with EDTA, they might come off the plate at this step. So be careful not to suck up your cells.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

47108.section: Regular maintenance of human pluripotent stem cells
47108.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"fkbaf","text":"Resuspend cells with   using a 5 ml pipette. Dislodge the cells only with media. DO NOT scrape cells off the plate with pipettes. Pipette cells up and down several times to break up cell clumps.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":21,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"3","guid":"325E75906B0211EBA98D07E9020DF081","id":0,"label":"fresh E8","unit":2}}}}

47108.section: Regular maintenance of human pluripotent stem cells
47108.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"bmj97","text":"Aliquot resuspended cells into another plate with fresh E8.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

47108.section: Regular maintenance of human pluripotent stem cells
47108.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"216vs","text":"I normally split cells at series of different ratios (1:6, 1:12 and 1:20).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3fult","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"acrt0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"1e5f5","text":"A 1:6 split will normally give you 50-70% confluency after 2 days. This is good for electroporation. A 1:20 split will give you 70-90% confluency after 4-5 days and this is good for regular maintenance especially for double feeding over the weekend.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

47108.section: Freezing cells
47108.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"chjji","text":"Split cells at 1:3 or 1:6 two days before freeze. Cells 2 days after split will give the best survival after thaw. You can still freeze cells 4 or 5 days after split if you have to. But the survival will be significantly reduced especially if the cells are confluent.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

47108.section: Freezing cells
47108.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"89eih","text":"Label appropriate number of cryovials you need for freezing. Also make sure you have appropriate number of Mr. Frosty.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

47108.section: Freezing cells
47108.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"3gpr","text":"Treat cells with EDTA just like what you would do when you split cells.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a77km","text":"Resuspend cells with fresh E8 in half the volume you want to freeze your cells in.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

47108.section: Freezing cells
47108.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"bgir1","text":"Prepare   by mixing 8 parts of E8 with 2 parts of DMSO.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":8,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"","data":{"concentration":"20","guid":"3566B7106B0311EBA98D07E9020DF081","id":0,"label":"DMSO in E8","unit":124}}}}

47108.section: Freezing cells
47108.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"cqqe4","text":"Slowly add the same volume of   to the resuspended cells with gentle mixing. This will give   final concentration in the freezing solution.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":30,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":92,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"","data":{"concentration":"20","guid":"576E91706B0311EBA98D07E9020DF081","id":0,"label":"DMSO in E8","unit":124}},"1":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"","data":{"concentration":"10","guid":"73D895E06B0311EBA98D07E9020DF081","id":0,"label":"DMSO","unit":124}}}}

47108.section: Freezing cells
47108.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"886n9","text":"Aliquot the cells into appropriate number of cryovials.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

47108.section: Freezing cells
47108.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"7l4qb","text":"Put vials into Mr. Frosty and place the Mr. Frosty in a   freezer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":56,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"800817A06B0311EBA98D07E9020DF081","id":0,"label":"","temperature":"-80","unit":10}}}}

47108.section: Freezing cells
47108.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"ba82d","text":"The next day, transfer all the vials to liquid nitrogen tank for long-term storage. Human pluripotent stem cells are good for several months at  . But it is general not recommended to keep your frozen cells at   for an extended period of time.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":144,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":210,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"8C1348806B0311EBA98D07E9020DF081","id":0,"label":"","temperature":"-80","unit":10}},"1":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"9882B9706B0311EBA98D07E9020DF081","id":0,"label":"","temperature":"-80","unit":10}}}}

47108.section: Freezing cells
47108.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"7kncb","text":"(Optional). Thaw one vial of cells to check on the survival rate. Repeat the freezing if survival is not optimal.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

47108.section: Freezing cells
47108.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"bqdps","text":"Generally, a 70-80% confluent well in a 6-well plate can give you 2-3 vials cells.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

47110.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"4n0ca","text":"Treat H9 AAVS1-TRE3G-NGN2 cells with Accutase and plate the dissociated cells in matrigel-coated 6-well plates (2x105 cells/well) in ND1 Medium supplemented with Y27632 ( ).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":116,"length":1},{"style":"bold","offset":133,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":170,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"","data":{"concentration":"10","guid":"322FBD106B0511EB91F1559E069C2CD1","id":0,"label":"","unit":29}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3rshj","text":"Treat the cells with Accutase and replate the dissociated cells in matrigel-coated 6-well plates (2-4x105 cells/well) in ND2 Medium.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":104,"length":1},{"style":"bold","offset":121,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fodk8","text":"Exchange 50% of the medium from each well every other day.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"r75k","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bhpa0","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"7l7ot","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"39v2r","text":"* Doxycycline can be withdrawn on Day 10 (or even earlier-not tested yet).","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"fo98r","text":"* Cells can be split from Day 5 to Day 7 (or even earlier-not tested yet).","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

description: {"blocks":[{"key":"c44e4","text":"This is a protocol for differentiating AAVS1-TRE3G-NGN2 iPSCs and hESCs to iNeurons directly on EM grids for cryo-ET and cryo-CLEM. The protocol comprises the following steps:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4ila0","text":"EM grids coating with Matrigel or Poly-Ornithine and Laminin; ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8740q","text":"differentiation and seeding of iNeurons on EM grids; ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"862jb","text":"lentiviral transduction for transient expression of fluorescently-labelled proteins; ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cmeks","text":"plunge freezing. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eued5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

keywords: cryo-ET, iNeurons, hESC, iPSCs, differentiation, in situ, CLEM, FIB-milling, lentivirus,EM
materials_text: {"blocks":[{"key":"2jnnq","text":"CELL LINES:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":11}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fknav","text":"H9 ES cells + AAVS-TRE3G-NGN2 (Ordureau et al., 2020);","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5ghvm","text":"iPSCs KOLF2.0 + AAVS-TRE3G-NGN2.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a8d68","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1kcvi","text":"CELL CULTURE MEDIA RECIPES: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":28}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6u5k6","text":"Please refer to the protocols listed in the references. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e62ue","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9fnl9","text":"EM GRIDS:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"21h6o","text":"Quantifoil Au grids, carbon or SiO2 film, R 1/4, R2/4, R2/2, R2/1. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":34,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e3v86","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9tbgg","text":"DISHES WITH FOUR INNER RINGS:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":29}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"tj5o","text":"Cell culture dish, 35/10 mm, four inner rings (Greiner bio-one);","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"15bf2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6hs9o","text":"GRID COATING REAGENTS:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":22}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3oamc","text":"Matrigel (Corning); ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5f26g","text":"Poly-L-ornithine solution, 0.01%, ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"86ah6","text":"Laminin from Engelbreth-Holm_swarm murin.  ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"n1nj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2127i","text":"PLUNGE-FREEZING:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":16}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1lkjv","text":"Dynabeads MyOne, 1 μm;","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aambl","text":"Whatman blotting paper.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a0c0d","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f0p8b","text":"INSTRUMENTS:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":12}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bgr96","text":"Plasma-cleaner (Harrick);","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3u09i","text":"Vitrobot Mark IV (Thermo-Fisher);","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ffpqf","text":"EM GP2 Plunger (Leica).","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8flm3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

(2020) ‘Global Landscape and Dynamics of Parkin and USP30-Dependent Ubiquitylomes in iNeurons during Mitophagic Signaling’, Molecular Cell, 77(5), pp. 1124-1142.e10. doi: 10.1016/j.molcel.2019.11.013.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":13,"length":6},{"style":"italic","offset":144,"length":14}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cm0gk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1g85d","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"F58A1625E8D811ED90B70A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://dx.doi.org/10.17504/protocols.io.br9cm92w"}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"1493B4B1E4FF11ED820D0A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://dx.doi.org/10.17504/protocols.io.br9em93e"}}}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"4m1k5","text":"We based our neural differentiation protocol, for both iPSCs and hESCs AAVS1-TRE3G-NGN2 cells, on: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9scm4","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"5ovjk","text":"We also refer to that protocol for a complete list of media and reagents. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dckkr","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9g6hf","text":"Follow the neural differentiation protocol until cell splitting on Day 6;","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7supm","text":"One well of a six well plate is enough to seed iNeurons on 10-20 EM grids at Day 6, depending on the desired cell density.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":65,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"protocols","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"id":47110,"title":"Neural differentiation of AAVS1-TRE3G-NGN2 pluripotent stem cells","title_html":"\u003cp\u003eNeural differentiation of AAVS1-TRE3G-NGN2 pluripotent stem cells\u003c/p\u003e","load_collapsed":true,"uri":"neural-differentiation-of-aavs1-tre3g-ngn2-pluripo-br9em93e","image":{"source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/d7gk7vcw.jpg","webp_source":null,"placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/d7gk7vcw.jpg","webp_placeholder":null},"creator":{"name":"Felix Kraus","affiliation":null,"affiliation_url":null,"username":"felix-kraus","link":"","image":{"source":"/img/avatars/003.png","placeholder":"/img/avatars/003.png","webp_source":""}},"stats":{"number_of_steps":6},"type_id":1,"guid":"B55854F0E59B11ED8ADFE105D88D01DC"}}}}

steps.section: EM grid preparation for neuronal culture seeding (Day 5)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"8que5","text":"Choosing grid type:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":19}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4tjse","text":"Use gold (Au) grids only for mammalian cell culture; copper (Cu) is cytotoxic;  ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ai33o","text":"iNeurons grow well on films with 1 μm and 2 μm holes. All following grid geometries worked in our hands: R 1/4, R2/4, R2/2, R2/1. Films with 2 μm holes may be preferred for direct TEM data acquisition on the processes. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7thqm","text":"Both carbon and silicon dioxide (SiO2) films work. SiO2  is preferred when preparing samples for FIB-milling. In our hands, iNeurons did not grow on UltraAUfoil gold film grids.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":36,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":54,"length":3}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3b9r3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"com1o","text":"Start preparing EM grids one day before seeding the iNeurons. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":62},{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":62}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Maintenance of iPSCs and hESC cell lines
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"bjh6a","text":"For maintenance of both induced pluripotent stem cells (iPSCs) and human embryonic stem cells (hESCs) as well as for a complete list of media and reagents, we refer to this protocol:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"j622","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"2ci7l","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"protocols","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"id":47108,"title":"Human pluripotent stem cell culture","title_html":"\u003cp\u003eHuman pluripotent stem cell culture\u003c/p\u003e","load_collapsed":true,"uri":"human-pluripotent-stem-cell-culture-br9cm92w","image":{"source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/d7g87vcw.jpg","webp_source":null,"placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/d7g87vcw.jpg","webp_placeholder":null},"creator":{"name":"Felix Kraus","affiliation":null,"affiliation_url":null,"username":"felix-kraus","link":"","image":{"source":"/img/avatars/003.png","placeholder":"/img/avatars/003.png","webp_source":""}},"stats":{"number_of_steps":28},"type_id":1,"guid":"3CC0F830E50511ED85D3E9E31CDEC10F"}}}}

steps.section: EM grid preparation for neuronal culture seeding (Day 5)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"b2tsk","text":"Plasma cleaning","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":15}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9124e","text":"Carefully place EM grids on a glass slide and plasma clean the grids for 30 seconds. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: EM grid preparation for neuronal culture seeding (Day 5)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"f7m6h","text":"UV-treating","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":11}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e2r7r","text":"Treat the grids with UV-light for 20 min. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: EM grid preparation for neuronal culture seeding (Day 5)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"3h43n","text":"Coating grids ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":14}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fpuuu","text":"We suggest two methods, coating grids with matrigel or poly-Ornithin + Laminin (PO+L). Both methods worked well for hESC-derived iNeurons, while iPSC-derived iNeurons seemed to grow better on POL+L coated grids.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":43,"length":9},{"style":"bold","offset":55,"length":32}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c1cmd","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fclqs","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"53jin","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"a3mhu","text":"Sometimes EM grids are hard to handle during coating and washing steps, they may float to or move around the dish, which may cause breaking of the film or bending of the grid. If you experience similar problems, here are few tricks:","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"ee1ej","text":"use a 10 μl drop of buffer to \"glue\" the grid to the bottom of the dish when first placing it in the culture dish; ","type":"unordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"enjp1","text":"never let the grids dry completely whenever removing medium during washing steps; instead, leave a thin film of liquid and increase the number of washing steps. ","type":"unordered-list-item"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

steps.section: EM grid preparation for neuronal culture seeding (Day 5)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"81k67","text":"Method 1: Coating grids with Matrigel ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":38}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"59c23","text":"thaw the Matrigel in ice and dissolve it in cold DMEM/F12 medium; ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"46po9","text":"dispense 100 μl on top of each grid to form a a small dome;","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"opu1","text":"incubate overnight at 37 °C; ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"t01a","text":"the grids are ready for use the next day. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: EM grid preparation for neuronal culture seeding (Day 5)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"esqrn","text":"Method 2: Coating grids with PO+L","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":33}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6vf3g","text":"dispense 100 μl of poly-ornithine solution (0.01%) on top of every grid;","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"epp93","text":"incubate at RT for 4 hours in a sterile container;","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2ir5p","text":"remove the PO solution and add 100 μl of Laminin (dissolved in PBS at a final concentration of 0.2 μg/ml);","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2v81h","text":"incubate overnight at RT;","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9cmln","text":"the next day wash 3 times with PBS and store with 100 μl ND2 or DMEM/F12 on top till cell seeding;","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: EM grid preparation for neuronal culture seeding (Day 5)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"6sjqu","text":"Prepare 3.5 mm dishes with four inner rings (see materials). This kind of dish allow to use smaller quantity of medium and cells for seeding. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":15,"length":28}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e58ns","text":"Use tweezers to transfer each grid inside of one inner ring of the culture dish. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9rl4q","text":"iPSC and hESC-derived iNeurons can be successfully seeded on grid on any day between 5 and 7. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":94}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dkpug","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"28dpt","text":"Detach the cells and count:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":27}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"lal2","text":"wash the cells with PBS;","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9np0f","text":"add Accutase (1 ml for one well) and incubate for 5 minutes at 37 °C;","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"enuuj","text":"add 5 ml of ND2 medium;","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"avn6","text":"use a 1 ml pipette to pipette the cells up and down to obtain single cells;","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"uh37","text":"OPTIONAL: pass the cells through a cell strainer;","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f7e17","text":"transfer to 15 ml tube and count the cells.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dn29o","text":"After the cells attached, carefully add 2 ml of ND2 medium. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"16rt1","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"a8vqb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"afle8","text":"Always add medium by gently pipetting it on the wall of the dish, to avoid to stress the cells and move the grids around the dish. ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e295b","text":"Exchange 50% of the medium every other day, as explained in the neural differentiation protocol; ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9o89r","text":"Withdraw Doxycycline on Day 10 for hESC-derived iNeurons, or around Day 15 for iPSC-derived iNeurons. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dlo9v","text":"Dilute to desired density and seed: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":36}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"flst5","text":"Prepare cell dilution in ND2 medium: seed 1500 cells in a volume of 150 μl on top of each grid (See note: How many cells should I seed on the grid? );","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":96,"length":51}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8uccd","text":"Leave the cells in the incubator for 1 or 2 hours while they attach on the grid. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6aluj","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"cik33","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":30,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"atkgu","text":"How many cells should I seed? ","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"cbkg6","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"fb6hb","text":"In general, iNeurons grow better and differently on the dish compared to EM grids. On grids, the denser they are, the better they will grow by creating a thick network of processes;","type":"unordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":1,"offset":58,"style":"sup"},{"length":1,"offset":218,"style":"sup"}],"key":"667kv","text":"Aim for lower cell densities (1500 cells in 150 μl, 1 X 104 cell/ml) if  you plan to image thin areas in the processes directly by TEM. If you plan instead to do FIB-milling you can seed at higher density (up to 1 X 105 cells/ml) to get more somata or thick processes. Pay attention, too high concentration, resulting in thicker sample, will not allow vitrification by plunge-freezing.  ","type":"unordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"fdb7m","text":"Test a range of different cell densities during the first experiment. ","type":"unordered-list-item"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

steps.section: Lentiviral transduction for fluorescence marker expression on EM grids (Day 9-14)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"5a1gn","text":"In order to express fluorescently-labelled proteins for CLEM experiments, we use transient expression via lentiviral transduction. Before transducing iNeurons on EM grids, determine the correct quantity of virus to add by titrating it on control cell culture dishes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6ivto","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"73des","text":"On the day of viral transduction:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":33}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9c6v1","text":"Exchange half of the medium as usual;","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"313t3","text":"If co-transducing with different viruses, pre-mix the different viruses in 200 μl of medium;","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eij63","text":"Dilute the virus in 200 μl of culture medium;","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fkdf6","text":"Apply the virus solution dropwise on top of the dish;","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d8el4","text":"Incubate the cells and do not exchange medium the following day.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7t7qg","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d2c3g","text":"Two days after viral transduction: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":35}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8vge6","text":"Start exchanging half of the medium with fresh ND2. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"59mri","text":"                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"92mkm","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"6csle","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"912u4","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"cpbot","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"safety","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"230jq","text":"When working with lentiviruses and lentivirus-infected cells follow Biosafety Level 2 protocols and safety rules.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"9m9m0","text":"In order to minimize background cryo fluorescence, you may want to switch to phenol-red free Neurobasal medium for ND2 preparation at this point of the  sample preparation. This is especially important if you are planning to use blue fluorophores (excitation in the UV range).  ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f3sc7","text":"If possible, store cells in an incubator close to the plunge-freezing set up during plunging day;  ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b68dk","text":"Be very careful when moving and transporting grids and dishes, shake the dishes as little as you can and minimize their time outside of the incubator. iNeurons are very fragile and have a tendency to detach from the grid when shaken. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f8o78","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"onb8","text":"We propose two methods for two commonly used plunge-freezing instruments, Vitrobot Mark IV and Leica EM GP2. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":74,"length":16},{"style":"bold","offset":95,"length":12}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"81gie","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"l5h7","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"4q1q0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cbel1","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"fkv39","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"safety","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"1q25a","text":"Liquid nitrogen (LN2) and other cryogens, like ethane-propane, can cause severe damage to the skin and eyes. Always wear personal protective equipment when handling these cryogens ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"9br91","text":"Here below we share settings that worked well for two plunge-freezing machines in our lab. However, it is extremely important that you test and find the optimal settings for your own plunge-freezing system;","type":"unordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"doir2","text":"Any setting that already worked for mammalian adherent cell cultures on EM grids should work well for iNeurons.","type":"unordered-list-item"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"73gbu","text":"Method 1: Plunging with Vitrobot Mark IV","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":40}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"382ij","text":"apply 4 μl;","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"du0gp","text":"Settings:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":9},{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7m2eh","text":"Blot force: 8;  Blot time: 10;  Chamber humidity: 70%.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2itp0","text":"Blot from the back: one teflon sheet + blotting paper, teflon only on front pad. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"24sjo","text":"Method 2: Plunging with Leica EM GP2","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":36}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"broae","text":"apply 4 μl;","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fqq3k","text":"Settings:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":9},{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"allnt","text":"Blot time: 7.0 sec; Horizontal blot position: 43.2 mm /43.0 mm; Vertical blot position: 2.7 mm; Chamber humidity: 95%.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e3js0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ah418","text":"When preparing sample for correlative FIB-milling, apply 4 μl of medium containing 1 μm autofluorescent beads (Dynabeads, diluted 1:20) before blotting. If not, just apply 4 μl of culture medium.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4nluf","text":"Plunge in ethane-propane or ethane. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"92qm8","text":"Store your grids in LN2. The iNeurons samples are ready to be directly imaged by Cryo-ET or imaged by cryo-FLM and subsequently FIB-milled.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

title: Neural differentiation on EM grids - iNeurons sample preparation for cryo-ET and CLEM
title_html: Neural differentiation on EM grids - iNeurons sample preparation for cryo-ET and CLEM

versions.title: Neural differentiation on EM grids - iNeurons sample preparation for cryo-ET and CLEM
versions.title_html: Neural differentiation on EM grids - iNeurons sample preparation for cryo-ET and CLEM

warning: {"blocks":[{"key":"b20me","text":"For all chemicals, please refer to Safety Data Sheets (SDS) for health and environmental hazards. Liquid nitrogen (LN2) and other cryogens, like ethane-propane, can cause severe damage to the skin and eyes. Always wear personal protective equipment when handling these cryogens. When working with lentiviruses and lentivirus-infected cells follow Biosafety Level 2 protocols and safety rules.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
